term.title: topochemical reaction

item.text: A reversible or irreversible reaction that involves the introduction of a guest species into a host structure and that results in significant structural modifications to the host, for example, the breakage of bonds. Example: The insertion of lithium at 50°C into the spinel Li[Mn2]O4 with symmetry F d3m to yield a layered structure with symmetry P 3 ̄ m1. [image: Not defined] Alternative terms: topotactic reaction, insertion reaction.
